definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To chop or cut down in a rough manner. [circa 12th c.]
examples: They hacked the brush down and made their way through the jungle.

definitions.definition: To withstand or put up with a difficult situation. [20th c.]
examples: Can you hack it out here with no electricity or running water?

definitions.definition: ( computing ) To make a quick code change to patch a computer program , often one that, while being effective, is inelegant or makes the program harder to maintain.
examples: I hacked in a fix for this bug, but we'll still have to do a real fix later.

definitions.definition: ( computing ) To accomplish a difficult programming task.
examples: He can hack like no one else and make the program work as expected.

definitions.definition: ( computing , slang , transitive ) To work with something on an intimately technical level.
examples: I'm currently hacking distributed garbage collection.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , colloquial , by extension ) To apply a trick, shortcut, skill, or novel method to something to increase productivity, efficiency or ease.
examples: I read up on dating tips so I can hack my sex life.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , slang , computing ) To hack into ; to gain unauthorized access to (a computer system, e.g., a website, or network) by manipulating code.
( transitive , slang , computing , by extension ) To gain unauthorised access to a computer or online account belonging to (a person or organisation).
examples: When I logged in to the social network, I discovered I'd been hacked .

definitions.definition: ( intransitive , video games ) To cheat by using unauthorized modifications .
examples: That player must be hacking , they got so many kills last game.

definitions.definition: ( ice hockey ) To strike an opponent with one's hockey stick , typically on the leg but occasionally and more seriously on the back, arm, head, etc.
examples: He's going to the penalty box after hacking the defender in front of the goal.
Jensen gets a 5 minute major penalty for hacking Orsov in the back.

definitions.definition: ( ice hockey ) To make a flailing attempt to hit the puck with a hockey stick.
examples: There's a scramble in front of the net as the forwards are hacking at the bouncing puck.

definitions.definition: ( baseball ) To swing at a pitched ball.
examples: He went to the batter's box hacking .

definitions.definition: ( soccer and rugby ) To kick (a player) on the shins .
To strike in a frantic movement.
( transitive ) To strike lightly as part of tapotement massage .

secondary_definitions: To withstand or put up with a difficult situation. [20th c.]

( computing ) To accomplish a difficult programming task.

To strike in a frantic movement.

definitions.definition: To lay (bricks) on a rack to dry.
( falconry ) To keep (young hawks) in a state of partial freedom, before they are trained.

main_definition: To lay (bricks) on a rack to dry.
secondary_definitions: ( falconry ) To keep (young hawks) in a state of partial freedom, before they are trained.

definitions.definition: ( dated ) To make common or cliched ; to vulgarise .
( equestrianism ) To ride a horse at a regular pace; to ride on a road (as opposed to riding cross-country etc.).
( obsolete ) To live the life of a drudge or hack.
To use as a hack; to let out for hire.
To use frequently and indiscriminately, so as to render trite and commonplace.
To drive a hackney cab .

definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To cough noisily. [19th c.]
examples: This cold is awful. I can't stop hacking .

definitions.definition: To play hackeysack .
